about.description:
The silx project aims at providing a collection of Python packages to
support the development of data assessment, reduction and analysis
applications at synchrotron radiation facilities. It aims at providing
reading/writing different file formats, data reduction routines and a set
of Qt widgets to browse and visualize data.
about.summary: The silx project aims at providing a collection of Python packages to support the development of data assessment, reduction and analysis applications at synchrotron radiation facilities.

name: silx
raw_recipe:
# This file created by conda-build 3.19.2
# ------------------------------------------------

package:
    name: silx
    version: 0.13.0
source:
    fn: silx-0.13.0.tar.gz
    sha256: 2853df6fe258f9a78ce6100ba81a19da6ca3e7aeffb815425a5992809932f24e
    url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/s/silx/silx-0.13.0.tar.gz
build:
    noarch: generic
    number: 0
    string: '0'
requirements:
    run:
        - ipython
        - mako
        - matplotlib
        - pillow
        - pyqt
        - python-dateutil
        - qtconsole
        - scipy
        - silx-base >=0.13.0,<0.13.1.0a0
about:
    description: 'The silx project aims at providing a collection of Python packages
        to

        support the development of data assessment, reduction and analysis

        applications at synchrotron radiation facilities. It aims at providing

        reading/writing different file formats, data reduction routines and a set

        of Qt widgets to browse and visualize data.

        '
    dev_url: https://github.com/silx-kit/silx
    doc_url: http://www.silx.org/doc/silx/latest/
    home: https://github.com/silx-kit/silx
    license: MIT
    license_family: MIT
    license_file: copyright
    summary: The silx project aims at providing a collection of Python packages to
        support the development of data assessment, reduction and analysis applications
        at synchrotron radiation facilities.
extra:
    copy_test_source_files: true
    final: true
    recipe-maintainers:
        - CJ-Wright
        - t20100
        - tschoonj
        - vallsv

The silx project aims at providing a collection of Python packages to

applications at synchrotron radiation facilities. It aims at providing
reading/writing different file formats, data reduction routines and a set
